mega.description: the company made its third consecutive appearance on Fortune's Fastest-Growing Companies list
its first store in Europe, a flagship shop in Covent Garden, London
Laurent Potdevin resigned as CEO and from the company's board due to misconduct related to a relationship he was having with a then-employee and later contractor

announced an investment in MIRROR, a home exercise startup that sells an interactive fitness mirror with a camera and speakers for at-home workouts. Capitalizing on a growing trend of people conducting virtual workouts at home instead of going to a gym due to the COVID-19 pandemic
1,698 yoga teachers and students via advocacy groups Stand.earth and Actions Speaks Louder wrote to the company demanding a transition to 100% renewable energy by 2030.
increasing into the top 448 companies globally

medium.description: A positive viral trend on social media promotes Jojo Corporation's athletic wear.
Jojo Corporation launches a new line of eco-friendly products.
Economic conditions result in increased consumer spending on fitness-related products.
A key supplier for Jojo Corporation faces financial troubles.
